text.0: whether o aśvins ye this day be far remote or near at hand.
text.1: in many spots or in midair come hither lords of ample wealth.
text.2: these here who show oer widest space bringing full many a wondrous act.
text.3: resistless lovingly i seek i call the mightiest to enjoy.
text.4: another beauteous wheel have ye fixed there to decorate your car.
text.5: with others through the realms ye roam in might unto the neighbouring tribes.
text.6: that deed of yours that is extolled visvas hath all been done with this.
text.7: born otherwise and spotless ye have entered kinships bonds with us.
text.8: when sūrya mounted on your car that rolls for ever rapidly.
text.9: birds of red hue were round about and burning splendours compassed you.
text.10: atri bethinks himself of you o heroes with a friendly mind.
text.11: what time nāsatyas with his mouth he stirs the spotless flame for you.
text.12: strong is your swiftly moving steed famed his exertion in the course.
text.13: when by your great deeds aśvins chiefs atri is brought to us again.
text.14: lovers of sweetness rudras she who streams with sweetness waits on you.
text.15: when ye have travelled through the seas men bring you gifts of welldressed food.
text.16: aśvins with truth they call you twain bestowers of felicity.
text.17: at sacrifice most prompt to hear most gracious ye at sacrifice.
text.18: most pleasing to the aśvins be these prayers which magnify their might.
text.19: which we have fashioned even as cars high reverence have we spoken forth.
